items.title: Step-by-Step Instructions for Crime-Solving in the City
items.abstract: The New York Police Department has been moving, through a series of memos, to standardize detective work and codify crime-solving tactics that had mostly existed as an oral tradition.

items.title: A South Korean City Full of Food, History and Bargains
items.abstract: I spend my life looking for places like Jeonju, a city barely known to Western travelers. It’s a paradise for both lovers of Korean food and cheap prices.

items.title: In Nigeria’s Largest City, Homeless Are Paying the Price of Progress
items.abstract: As Lagos tries to raise its business profile, the city’s poor feel they have become the government’s enemy, a feeling deepened by the dismantling of a slum last week.

items.title: Long Isolated Behind a Freeway, Santa Monica’s Civic Center Rejoins Its City
items.abstract: A residential development and a new park with playgrounds are helping to integrate a forgotten part of Santa Monica, Calif., with the city’s downtown.

items.title: A Once-Vibrant City Struggles as Panama Races Ahead on a Wave of Prosperity
items.abstract: While Panama rides a 9 percent growth rate, joblessness and squalor in Colón, whose black residents say they face racism, appear to only increase.

items.title: On Java, a Creative Explosion in an Ancient City
items.abstract: The last sultanate in Indonesia has emerged as one of the world’s most vibrant centers of artistic innovation and risk-taking.

items.title: When the Kitchen Is Also a Bedroom: Overcrowding Worsens in New York
items.abstract: In the census district encompassing the Queens neighborhoods of Elmhurst and southern Corona, a quarter of all residential units are considered crowded.

items.title: Airbnb Pits Neighbor Against Neighbor in Tourist-Friendly New Orleans
items.abstract: Opponents complain that short-term strangers squeeze out long-term residents, but supporters say renting out rooms allows them to make extra income.

items.title: Miami City Ballet: Feeling That Warmth and Attack
items.abstract: The troupe’s artistic director, who took over in 2012, is bringing the company to New York for several performances.

items.title: At L’Appart in Battery Park City, You’ll Feel at Home
items.abstract: Also, Tim Powell offers food for delivery, Desi Galli opens a second location, Galen Zamarra is closing Almanac, and more.

items.title: How Cities Make Money by Fining the Poor
items.abstract: In many parts of America, like Corinth, Miss., judges are locking up defendants who can’t pay — sometimes for months at a time.

items.title: How New York City Ended Up With 2 Competing Women’s Marches
items.abstract: At issue is the question of inclusivity, one that has haunted the national movement since its inception.

items.title: Lagos, City of Hustle, Builds an Art ‘Ecosystem’
items.abstract: West Africa’s new art destination is a sprawling megacity with a generation of artists, gallerists and collectors powering the scene.

items.title: Sex in New York City Parks? It’s Less of a Thing Than It Used to Be
items.abstract: A decade ago, New York City police officers handed out hundreds of tickets for “sex in park.” Last year, they wrote six.

items.title: ‘Aim, I Say, at the City of Washington!’ Russia Revives Cold War Playbook
items.abstract: A prime-time news show talks about deploying nuclear submarines along the coast of the United States, and a church choir sings about nuking America.
keywords: United States Defense and Military Forces

items.title: The Plans for the World’s Next Largest City Are Incomplete
items.abstract: Delhi is growing far beyond the formal confines of the city, a case study in the complexity of what we call urbanization.

items.title: Sarah Palin, who is unvaccinated, recently dined indoors in New York City before testing positive.
items.abstract: Elio’s, an Upper East Side celebrity haunt, confirms that it let her in despite a city requirement that all indoor guests show proof of vaccination. Ms. Palin tested positive for the coronavirus on Monday.

items.title: Is There Medical Neglect in New York City Jails?
items.abstract: A court filing says missed appointments lead to serious health consequences.

items.title: An Ancient City Transformed by War
items.abstract: Simple rituals, like having coffee in a cafe in Lviv, Ukraine, take on a new and sometimes surreal meaning in a radically altered context.

items.title: Keeping a Jeweler’s Design Vision in the Family
items.abstract: The granddaughter of Fred’s founder aims to enrich the Paris brand with updated collections drenched in its own history.
keywords: LVMH Moet Hennessy Louis Vuitton SA
